---
title: "sidebar"
icon: "table-columns"
description: "Add a customizable sidebar to your Preswald app"
---

```python
sidebar(defaultopen = True) -> Dict
```

The `sidebar` function adds a sidebar to your app, optionally allowing you to customize the logo and title.

## Parameters

- **`defaultopen`** _(bool, default=True)_:  
  Whether to expand the sidebar on desktop by default.

- **`logo`** _(str, optional)_:  
  A URL pointing to the logo image shown at the top of the sidebar.  
  Example: `"https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/a/a7/React-icon.svg"`

- **`name`** _(str, optional)_:  
  A string to be shown as the title next to the logo in the sidebar.  
  Example: `"Iris Dashboard"

<Frame>
<img
  className="block dark:hidden"
  src="/images/sidebar.png"
  alt="Hero Light"
/>
</Frame>

## Returns

- `Dict` with sidebar component data

## Usage Example

Here's an example of how to add a customizable sidebar to your app:

```python
from preswald import sidebar

sidebar(
    defaultopen=True,
    logo="https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/a/a7/React-icon.svg",
    name="Iris Dashboard"
)
```

### Key Features

1. **Custom Branding**: Set a custom logo and title to match your brand or app.
2. **Control**: You can use sidebar only if needed which gives you the full control.
3. **Easy to use**: No configuration needed—just call the function.

### Why Use `sidebar`?

The sidebar helps organize navigation in your Preswald app and can now also visually reflect your app’s identity through branding.
